success_criteria.notes: Success if the assistant reschedules the Panel Discussion meeting from 2025-12-11 to 2025-12-15 via update_meeting.

injected_behaviors.instructions: The user needs to reschedule a panel discussion that was originally scheduled for next week. They prefer moving it to later in the week.

persona.name: Sofía Reyes
persona.bio: Sofía Reyes teaches modern history and writes essays about what today's events reveal about society. She moderates panel discussions, travels for lectures, and keeps a meticulous planner so she can balance classes, writing deadlines, and family life.
persona.writing_style: Professional clarity, proper capitalization and punctuation, structured
sample_messages: I need dinner Friday but not before 8:30, my lecture runs until 8.
Have all three panelists confirmed for the roundtable?
The Madrid flight is delayed two hours. Should I rebook or wait it out?

messages.output_raw: I need to reschedule a “Panel Discussion” meeting that is currently on my calendar for next week.

steps.output_raw:
<think>
User wants to reschedule a specific meeting. I need to locate it via find_meeting, but I need more specifics (they said "next week" but not date/time, and there could be multiple meetings titled "Panel Discussion"). I'll clarify details and then plan to find and update the meeting. Keep it concise and move toward tool use once I have enough info. </think>
<plan>
1. Ask a few clarifying questions to uniquely identify the existing “Panel Discussion” meeting.
2. Use the find_meeting tool to locate the event once I have enough details.
3. Propose new times (either based on user input or by checking availability).
4. Use update_meeting to reschedule the event.
5. Confirm the changes to the user.
</plan>
<action type="say">
To reschedule it, I first need to locate the exact event on your calendar.

Can you tell me:
1) The date it’s currently scheduled for next week (or the exact datetime if you know it)?
2) Any key attendees’ email addresses (e.g., panelists or host)?
3) How long the meeting is (e.g., 60 minutes)?
4) When you’d like to move it to (specific date/time, or just “later that week in the afternoon,” etc.)?

Once I have that, I’ll look it up and reschedule it for you.</action>

action_structured.text:
To reschedule it, I first need to locate the exact event on your calendar.

Can you tell me:
1) The date it’s currently scheduled for next week (or the exact datetime if you know it)?
2) Any key attendees’ email addresses (e.g., panelists or host)?
3) How long the meeting is (e.g., 60 minutes)?
4) When you’d like to move it to (specific date/time, or just “later that week in the afternoon,” etc.)?

Once I have that, I’ll look it up and reschedule it for you.

messages.output_raw:
It is currently scheduled for 11 December 2025.  
I would like to move it to later that same week, ideally on 15 December 2025.

steps.output_raw:
<think>
Need to find meeting by title and date, then reschedule to Dec 15 same time unless user specifies otherwise. Need duration and preferred time window; ask concise clarification. </think>
<plan>
1. Clarify time and duration of the existing meeting and preferred time window on 15 December.
2. Use find_meeting to locate the “Panel Discussion” on 11 December 2025.
3. Check for conflicts at the new proposed time using check_conflicts.
4. Use update_meeting to move the event if the slot works (or suggest alternatives if not).
5. Confirm the reschedule details with the user.
</plan>
<action type="say">
Got it: “Panel Discussion” on 11 December 2025, and you’d like to move it to 15 December 2025.

To proceed, I need a bit more detail:
1) What time is it currently scheduled on 11 December (start time and duration)?
2) On 15 December, do you want to keep roughly the same time, or do you have a preferred window (e.g., between 2–5 pm)?
3) Roughly how many key attendees are there, and do you know their email addresses? (This helps me check for conflicts before moving it.)

Once you share that, I’ll locate the event, check availability on the 15th, and reschedule it.</action>

action_structured.text:
Got it: “Panel Discussion” on 11 December 2025, and you’d like to move it to 15 December 2025.

To proceed, I need a bit more detail:
1) What time is it currently scheduled on 11 December (start time and duration)?
2) On 15 December, do you want to keep roughly the same time, or do you have a preferred window (e.g., between 2–5 pm)?
3) Roughly how many key attendees are there, and do you know their email addresses? (This helps me check for conflicts before moving it.)

Once you share that, I’ll locate the event, check availability on the 15th, and reschedule it.

messages.output_raw: I want to keep the same time and duration as on 11 December; I just need it moved to 15 December.

steps.output_raw:
<think>
Need to locate meeting by title and date, but I still don’t know the time/duration; however, I can search by title and date, then infer time/duration from found event and shift date only. Use find_meeting with title and start_date 2025-12-11, then update_meeting with new start/end on 2025-12-15. Ask nothing further now. </think>
<plan>
1. Use find_meeting to locate “Panel Discussion” on 2025-12-11.
2. If there are multiple matches, confirm the right one with the user; if single, compute new start/end on 2025-12-15.
3. Use update_meeting to move the event to 15 December at the same time and duration.
4. Confirm the reschedule details to the user.
</plan>
<action type="tool" name="find_meeting">
  { "meeting_title": "Panel Discussion", "start_date": "2025-12-11" }
</action>

      "ana.luque@ucm.es",

parsed.title: Panel Discussion
parsed.description: Panel Discussion on contemporary legal challenges and the future of European jurisprudence.

steps.output_raw:
<think>
We found a single matching Panel Discussion event with clear start/end times. User wants same time and duration but on Dec 15. I should compute new ISO datetimes and call update_meeting, then report success. </think>
<plan>
1. Use update_meeting to move EVT-010 from 2025-12-11T15:00–17:00Z to 2025-12-15T15:00–17:00Z.
2. Confirm the updated details to the user.
</plan>
<action type="tool" name="update_meeting">
  {
    "event_id": "EVT-010",
    "start_time": "2025-12-15T15:00:00Z",
    "end_time": "2025-12-15T17:00:00Z",
    "notify_attendees": true
  }
</action>

<think>
Meeting successfully updated; now I just need to confirm the new details succinctly. </think>
<plan>
1. Confirm to the user that the meeting has been rescheduled and summarize the new details.
</plan>
<action type="say">
Your “Panel Discussion” meeting has been rescheduled.

New details:
- Date: 15 December 2025  
- Time: 15:00–17:00 (same time and duration as before)  
- Location: Aula Magna, Facultad de Derecho  
- Attendees have been notified of the change.

Do you want to adjust anything else (title, description, or location)?</action>

action_structured.text:
Your “Panel Discussion” meeting has been rescheduled.

New details:
- Date: 15 December 2025  
- Time: 15:00–17:00 (same time and duration as before)  
- Location: Aula Magna, Facultad de Derecho

Do you want to adjust anything else (title, description, or location)?
